message.content:
cs.NE, cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a deep reinforcement learning approach to address the dynamic resource allocation problem in network slicing. This involves dealing with highly variable and dynamic traffic characteristics and job resource requirements, which are key challenges in network slicing. The paper also mentions the use of new technologies such as 5G and new architectures such as SDN and NFV, which are relevant to the networking and communication subfields of computer science. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also proposes a solution using deep reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with resource allocation and optimization, which are relevant to the systems and control subfield of computer science. Therefore, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a likely sub-category.
